description.desc1: Used to display the rendered result to an output device like a screen or projector.
description.desc2: The window node can slice its frame into (so called) viewports, arranged in rows and columns. Each slice (viewport) can be addressed with a ViewPort-node.
description.desc3: With the display-setup tool you can easily define the windows output size and postion relative to the desktop display.

position.descript: switch between the 'ouput' position and the 'desktop' position

columns and rows.descript: slice the window into the designated amount of rows (max 2) and columns (max 12)

vsync.descript: tries to sync the output framerate with the displays update frequency. not recomended.

floating.descript: for 'desktop': window will always stay on the foreground

border.descript: for 'desktop': when selected the windows borders are shown when positioned on the desktop.

escape.descript: for 'output': when pressing 'esc' the Window will swithc to 'desktop' position.

interact.descript: exposes an internal transformation node for direct 3d handling similar to the 3DViewer. The transformation node needs to be attached to a Camera-node, and its Capture-node renders out to this Window.

display.descript: opens the display-settings tool to define the 'output' position of this window.

desktop.descript: the 'desktop' position of this window. Is set automatically by draging and resizing the window

output.descript: the 'output' position of this window. Is set via display settings.

Notes.note1: close this help window if you dont need it. it actually blocks one of the four in SPARCK available windows...
